Authors:
Sandro Bogdanović, Salvatore Brullo, Ivana Reetnik, Dmitar
Lakuić, Zlatko Satovic, Zlatko Liber
Title:
Campanula skanderbegii: Molecular and Morphological Evidence
of a New Campanula Species (Campanulaceae) Endemic to Albania
Keywords:
Balkan Peninsula, endemism, isophyllous bellflowers,
phylogeny
Abstract:
A new species of Campanula from Central Albania, named C.
skanderbegii, belonging to isophyllous Campanula ser. Garganicae is
illustrated and described. Morphologically and phylogenetically it is
well differentiated from other species of this series. It is
morphologically similar to C. portenschlagiana from Central Dalmatia
(Croatia) based on corolla shape. Phylogenetic analyses, maximum
parsimony, maximum likelihood, and Bayesian inference, based on nuclear
ITS and chloroplast trnLtrnF data support C. skanderbegii as a clearly
distinct taxon within the isophyllous species of Campanula. A
distribution map for C. skanderbegii and a key to all species of
Campanula ser. Garganicae are provided. Because of its rarity and highly
restricted distribution, C. skanderbegii should be included in the IUCN
red list as a critically endangered species.
